description: Dive into "Cannes: A Romantic Journey Through Enchantment" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Cannes: A Romantic Journey Through Enchantment

places.generalDescription: Perched atop Le Suquet Hill in Cannes, √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance, also known as Lady of Hope Church, is a Gothic-style stone church dating back to the early 1600s. This historical landmark offers visitors a serene escape from the bustling city below. The interior boasts a blend of Gothic and Renaissance architecture, adorned with statues and fine wood paneling. Two chapels dedicated to craftsmen's brotherhoods add character to the church's ambiance.

sources.snippet: While in Cannes, make sure to add a visit to Norte Dame d'Esperance to your itinerary. This historic and magnificent site, situated in the heart of the city, is must-see. Dating back to the 14th and 15th centuries, this gothic church perched on a hill in Le Suquet offers breathtaking views of Cannes.
sources.shortName: Top Luxury Things to Do in Cannes, France
What to see and what to buy in Cannes

places.name: √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance de Cannes

reviews.text: √âglise Notre-Dame d'Esp√©rance in Cannes is a true piece of historic art, standing proudly atop Le Suquet with breathtaking views of the city and sea. The church's charming architecture and serene atmosphere make it an ideal escape from the bustling streets below. Whether you're admiring the intricate details of the interior or enjoying the peaceful courtyard, it's a place where hours pass without even noticing. The tranquil setting makes it perfect for reading, reflecting, or simply taking in the beauty of the surroundings.

What I really love about this church is that you can see the whole city of Cannes and from the bottom, from the bus station to the top, you have to walk slowly for about 20 minutes. It's 100% worth it

Beautiful. Calm. A place to visit in Cannes, especially if you're planning a short walk from the port.

Initiated in 1521, the church's construction spanned over a century, concluding in 1641. It was officially dedicated to Our Lady of Hope on March 25, 1645, coinciding with the Feast of the Annunciation. On my picture you can see the Statue of Our Lady of Hope: A 16th-century gilded wooden statue, donated by the Abbey of L√©rins, stands prominently above the high altar.

places.address: 1 Rue de la Castre, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: March√© Forville is a bustling indoor market located at the base of ancient Le Suquet in Cannes. It offers a wide variety of local produce, flowers, seafood, cheese, and more. The market is open six days a week and transforms into an antiques market on Mondays. Visitors can explore the colorful stalls filled with florists, cheesemongers, fishmongers, bakeries, and other food vendors offering continental delicacies.

sources.snippet: Food Enthusiasts, Market Lovers, Culinary Explorers, Fresh Produce Aficionados. At the foot of the hill leading up to Le Suquet sits the bustling Marche Forville, Canne‚Äôs largest covered market. It was pedestrianized in 2012 and given a makeover, giving it a bright white modern interior.
sources.shortName: 17 Can't Miss Things to Do When Visiting Cannes France

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a more casual date spot, March√© Forville is a great option. This outdoor market is filled with fresh produce, seafood, and flowers, and is a great place to browse with your date. You can also stop at one of the market‚Äôs many caf√©s for a casual meal.
sources.shortName: Cannes' Romantic Charm: The Top 8 Date Spots to Explore

sources.snippet: Right outside the neighbourhood is the March√© Forville, a superb indoor market. Here you can find cold meats, organic vegetables, delicious cheeses, fresh seafood, and even Italian food.
sources.shortName: Exclusive Things to do in Cannes

places.name: March√© Forville

reviews.text:
March√© Forville ‚Äì A Gourmet Delight in Cannes

March√© Forville is a fantastic destination for anyone who appreciates fresh, high-quality ingredients and a vibrant market atmosphere. Nestled in the heart of Cannes, this gourmet market offers an incredible selection of local produce, artisanal cheeses, fresh seafood, fragrant herbs, and delicious baked goods.

The variety here is impressive, with vendors showcasing the best seasonal fruits and vegetables, along with an array of cured meats, olives, and regional specialties. Whether you're looking for a quick bite, planning a picnic, or just want to soak in the lively ambiance, this market has something for everyone. The local vendors are passionate and knowledgeable, always happy to share recommendations or offer a taste of their products.

Beyond the food, the market is a cultural experience, reflecting the charm and flavors of the French Riviera. Arrive early to explore the best selections and enjoy the authentic energy of this bustling spot. It is also surrounded by great local restaurants, making it a perfect place to start your culinary adventure in Cannes.

If you get to Cannes, you have to visit this market which is famous. They have very affordable prices and you can find fresh vegetables and fruits. What I liked is that they also have a water fountain where you can wash the vegetables and fruits if you want to eat them. I recommendüíú
Get a real sense of how the locals market and  enjoy some beautiful food, wine and a great atmosphere too!  The passion for quality is absolutely evident on every stall.

places.address: 6 Rue du March√© Forville, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: √éle Sainte-Marguerite is a charming small island located just a ferry ride away from Cannes. It boasts beautiful beaches and an ancient fort, offering stunning views of the French Riviera. The island is also home to La Guerite, a renowned establishment since 1902, where visitors can enjoy exquisite dining experiences surrounded by lush Aleppo pine and eucalyptus trees.

sources.snippet: Equipped with a mask and snorkel, anyone can swim a few dozen metres from the Sainte-Marguerite Island to discover the statues of international artist Jason deCaires Taylor. The British sculptor, known worldwide for his works and his commitment to the protection of the seabed, has created 6 works for the first underwater eco-museum in France and the Mediterranean.
sources.shortName: Visit Cannes in 3 hours

sources.snippet: Take a short boat ride from Cannes to √éle Sainte-Marguerite, an island off the coast that‚Äôs perfect for a romantic picnic. You can rent a bike and explore the island‚Äôs beautiful nature trails, or simply relax on one of the island‚Äôs secluded beaches.
sources.shortName: Cannes' Romantic Charm: The Top 8 Date Spots to Explore

sources.snippet: Between Sainte-Marguerite Island and Saint-Honorat Island, you‚Äôll find something to delight you, whether it‚Äôs a historical stroll or a wine tasting from the monks‚Äô vineyards.
sources.shortName: Looking for romantic things to do in Cannes in 2025?

places.name: √éle Sainte-Marguerite

reviews.text: A great one-day trip destination. A stroll around the island will take you a couple of hours. Highly recommended it outside of high tourist season.
Very nice beaches and if you like to walk around the whole island you will find some very nice spots. Food in one of the two places available was very good.
Pretty place, expect lots of hiking. There are loads of small beaches but they get busy really quickly, I spent the whole day there but I reckon 4/5 hours would be more than enough.

places.generalDescription: The Carlton Beach Club is a chic restaurant located in Cannes, offering a laid-back beachside atmosphere and serving seafood, grilled meats, and cocktails. The venue is known for its vibrant ambiance and is a popular spot throughout the day. With friendly staff and a variety of unique cocktails and regional wines available, it's an ideal place to unwind by the beach. The Carlton Terrace is particularly famous for its lively atmosphere, where guests can enjoy drinks while watching the stars descend upon the red carpet.

sources.snippet: While Cannes is known for its palatial hotels, like the art deco Martinez and the belle √©poque Intercontinental Carlton, newer arrivals are infusing the scene with fresh energy‚Äîlike the √ºber-exclusive Le Grand Jardin Cannes, the revitalized 17th-century Ch√¢teau de Th√©oule, and the California-cool Maison Carla Rosa, as well as revamped iconic landmarks like Palm Beach, a Jazz Age members‚Äô club once frequented by the Duke and Duchess of Windsor. It‚Äôs the new golden age of Cannes, and the options for staying and playing are better than ever.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Cannes, the Jewel of the French Riviera

sources.snippet: It's where 1950s charm meets stunning sea views, from the majestic Esterel all the way to the calm L√©rins Islands. Every look is like a beautiful postcard. Sunbathe in style on our deck, or relax on beach beds and chairs.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Restaurants In Cannes

places.name: Carlton Beach Club

reviews.text:
We had an amazing time at the Carlton Beach Club! The food was delicious, the service excellent, and the team was super accommodating when our friends arrived ‚Äì they quickly arranged a large table for all of us.
A special shoutout to Maud for her warm smile and kindness throughout the service, it truly made the experience even better.
We absolutely loved it, thanks to the whole team! ‚ú®

We had a lovely experience at Carlton Beach Club in Cannes, a refined and elegant spot located right on the beach, with unbeatable views and a luxurious yet relaxed atmosphere.

The food and service were both excellent. The menu isn't vast, as you'd expect from more exclusive venues, but it's well curated and focused on quality. We ordered the pesto pasta and half chicken for mains, both beautifully prepared, before sharing a dessert right by the sea.

Service was attentive without being intrusive. I was unsure what to drink, and after a quick chat with our server about my preferences, I was recommended a glass of champagne, which turned out to be the perfect choice. Their suggestions were spot on throughout.

If you want to stay and enjoy the beach loungers but aren't a hotel guest, there is a surcharge per sunbed, around ‚Ç¨30 each from memory, so worth bearing in mind if you're planning to spend the afternoon. That said, it's an ideal place to relax for a special treat or beachside lunch. Highly recommended booking in advance, as you'd expect it gets very busy as priority is given to hotel guests.

The overall bill came to around ‚Ç¨100‚Äì‚Ç¨150 for two people, including two mains, one dessert to share, and drinks. For the location, quality, and service, we found it to be very fair value and would definitely return.

We had high expectations when we went and they were completely fulfilled. The food and drinks were on point and the atmosphere was top notch. But the key difference was the service. It was spectacular! Madeleine and the rest of the staff attended us with high standards, always with smiles and went the extra mile to make sure our stay was as pleasant as possible taking into account the scorching heat of the sun. I would return to Cannes just to relive this experience all over again. Thanks Madeleine and the Carlton Beach Club for a memorable day at the beach!

places.address: 58 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: Miramar Plage is a beachfront restaurant located in the heart of Croisette, between the iconic Martinez and Carlton hotels. It offers elegant dishes with international influences served on a shaded deck with stunning views of the sea and sunset. The restaurant provides professional service, attentive staff, and high-quality cuisine, specializing in wild fish served grilled or in salt crust.

sources.snippet: Miramar Plage is your luxury getaway on Cannes' famous Croisette. It's the perfect mix of peaceful beach days, fancy dining, and lively nights. Why we love it: Imagine this: relaxing on smooth sands during the day, then enjoying delicious meals that mix classic and new flavors.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Restaurants In Cannes

places.name: Miramar Plage

reviews.text: Dining on the beach near the sea was an absolutely delightful experience. The ambiance was perfect, with the soothing sounds of the waves and the fresh sea breeze enhancing our meal. One of the highlights was undoubtedly the tiramisu, which was not only the best we've ever had but also made even more special because it was prepared right in front of us on the beach. This added a unique and memorable touch to our evening. Miramar Plage in Cannes truly provided an awesome dining experience! ‚ù§Ô∏è We are so grateful for the wonderful time and excellent service. Thank you üôèüèª Miramar Plage Cannes for making our visit unforgettable. We highly recommend your restaurant to anyone looking for a remarkable culinary experience.

I recently visited the restaurant and was truly impressed in every way. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a relaxed dinner or a special occasion. The menu offers delicious dishes made with fresh, high-quality ingredients.

A special thanks to Andrea, the waiter, who was extremely professional and friendly. Always attentive to guests' needs, he gave excellent recommendations and made our experience even more enjoyable with his smile and helpfulness. I will definitely be coming back!

Food was fantastic, vibes immaculate, this restaurant put a lot of effort into the music (live DJ and instruments), high quality food, and prompt service, thank you Adrian.

We enjoyed our experience so much and will be back.

places.address: 64 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

places.generalDescription: La M√¥me, located in Cannes near the famous Croisette, offers a trendy and upscale dining experience that combines the glamour of the French Riviera with the charm of the Mediterranean. The restaurant pays homage to the iconic Mo Moineau and captures the vibrant spirit of Cannes. With chic yet comfortable decor and an in-house DJ setting the rhythm, La M√¥me provides a unique atmosphere for enjoying upscale Mediterranean cuisine, including pasta, grilled steak, and caviar.

sources.snippet: La M√¥me Cannes sits in the heart of the French Riviera, offering a blend of old-time glamour and modern style. This restaurant gives a dining experience that is both classic and unforgettable. Why we love it: It‚Äôs more than just eating out; it's a trip to the glamorous days of Hollywood with a French twist.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Restaurants In Cannes

places.name: La M√¥me

reviews.text: We were staying in Cannes and I made a reservation a week before our trip for this amazing restaurant I had heard about.  From the moment we arrived everything was outstanding.  WILLIAM üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª. You the man!  He and Paula took such good care of us from the moment we arrived and made the entire experience exceptional.  The salad, the Steak, the truffle mashed potatoes, the chocolate chip cookie at the end.... everything was incredible.  Beautiful people and atmosphere.  Great music.  Thank you to everyone for making it an unforgettable evening for us!  If we are blessed to return to the south of France we will absolutely return to La M√¥me!

It was a little cramped for our table of 9 and positioned under a speaker that seemed to increase in volume as the night went on.

Still, the food and service were excellent. It was quite pricy, but the food was mostly worth the price. Get the fish of the day, cocktail of the day, and whatever else your waitstaff recommends. They know what is best for you!

Marion was incredibly kind and accommodating. The presentation and experience of both the food and the venue were incredible. If you have a large group, get the dessert sampler/platter. It's incredible. Also, the artichoke salad was delicious.

One of the really nice restaurants I have visited. All categories score 5. The ambiance is so nice the service is great considering the crowd and the food is fantastic.

The Artichoke Salad is yummy. The pasta with clams and shrimp is excellent but ask for well done cooking for the pasta. The Fillet meat was excellent and cooked to order.

The staff and the ambience is great. The way how they pre-prepare and put the tables is something unique and i have never seen it. You will understand from the video i included or when you visit.

Highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: Plage de la Bocca, located in Cannes, is a popular sandy city beach that offers various activities such as swimming, sunbathing, and volleyball. It is known for its laid-back atmosphere and is less crowded compared to other beaches in the area. The beach has easy access and features golden fine sand and turquoise water. While it can get crowded during the peak season, there are nearby eateries and free parking available.
places.name: Plage de la Bocca

reviews.text: Small but lovely beach next to the road. Crazy beautiful color of the sea. Water soo warm and comfy. San more gray than gold. Shower next to entrance to the beach, very convenient. Not soo crowded. Great spot for relax and swim in the sea. Me and my GF had really great time there. Recommend!

So, the water's clear, the sand's clean, and it's easy to get to from the A8 highway. You can park for free right nearby (but get there early, it fills up fast!). No pebbles, the water's shallow and smooth, perfect for a hand-in-hand swim with my sweetie. <3

A few downsides: No restaurants right on the beach, just kiosks for snacks or coffee (convenient, but not super romantic).
A really nice beach to relax. It gets a bit crowded between 12 and 5 PM, but the water and the beach are very clean and feel safe.

places.generalDescription: Bd de la Croisette, also known as the Boulevard la Croisette, is a renowned seaside promenade in Cannes. It has a rich history, originally following an ancient seaside road and now famous for hosting events like the Festival International du Film. The boulevard is lined with luxury shops, high-end hotels, and exquisite dining options.

sources.snippet: A stroll along the Croisette is incredibly romantic, as you meander past the grand art deco hotels and gleaming superyachts, the pastel-painted buildings of the old town and, finally, around to the long stretch of golden sand lined with waving palms and fancy beach clubs. Or go for an evening stroll along the Croisette with the beautiful people, as the stars come out across the Riviera and the Mediterranean shines silver in the moonlight.
sources.shortName: 10 most romantic things to do in Cannes

sources.snippet: Indissociable from Cannes‚Äô identity, the Boulevard de la Croisette is a long seaside promenade, where it is good to stroll. Bordered on one side by the bay of Cannes, palm trees and pines, on the other by sumptuous buildings, luxurious boutiques and magnificent ‚Äúpalaces‚Äù, it forms a landscape worthy of a postcard. From the Palais des Festivals to the Palm Beach, it runs along the beaches of the Bay of Cannes for 3 kilometres.
sources.shortName: Visiting Cannes: the must-see places

sources.snippet: However, it only takes a few minutes of pleasant strolling to reach the Promenade de la Croisette, where you can get a taste of the vibrant atmosphere of our famous French Riviera city. After strolling by the water, why not treat yourself to a boat trip?. You can also visit renowned sites such as the Malmaison, the Palais des Festivals, the Villa Rothschild and the Notre-Dame-d'Esp√©rance, a lovely 16th century church.
sources.shortName: A romantic Valentine's Day break in Cannes

sources.snippet: 3 kilometres long, the famous La Croisette will undoubtedly fulfil all your every desire!. With its palm trees, wide sandy beach, legendary hotels, casinos, La Croisette offers a magnificent panorama of the Bay of Cannes and the Iles de L√©rins. Walk along the Chemin des Etoiles between the Esplanade Pompidou and the Palais des Festivals, to discover the handprints of the greatest international actors and directors.
sources.shortName: The top 10 things to see and do in cannes | C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur France

sources.snippet: The glamorous La Croisette, located in Cannes, France, is often likened to the renowned Promenade des Anglais in Nice. This famous street is lined with high-end shops, palm trees, and casinos, and runs parallel to the sea. Its luxurious hotels, some of which boast private beaches, add to the allure of this famous street.
sources.shortName: Top Luxury Things to Do in Cannes, France

sources.snippet: La Croisette is the iconic promenade that runs along the Cannes waterfront, offering stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. It‚Äôs the perfect place to take a leisurely stroll hand in hand with your loved one. The palm trees, beaches, and charming cafes along the way make for a perfect romantic date spot.
sources.shortName: Cannes' Romantic Charm: The Top 8 Date Spots to Explore

sources.snippet: Indulge in the luxury of Cannes by checking into one of the iconic hotels on the prestigious Boulevard de la Croisette. The InterContinental Carlton Cannes Hotel, H√¥tel Barri√®re Le Majestic, or H√¥tel Martinez offer unparalleled elegance and service, ensuring an unforgettable stay.
sources.shortName: Best things to do in Cannes, France this summer ‚Ä¢ SILC Academy

sources.snippet: As a matter of fact, the Palais des Festivals with its red carpet, the home of the famous Cannes Fim Festival amongst other events, is located just at the western end of La Croisette, near the Old Port.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Cannes: visit Cannes, city of Festivals on the FrenchRiviera

sources.snippet: The ideal district for those looking for a glamorous break with breathtaking views over the Mediterranean. Here you‚Äôll find luxury boutiques and upmarket restaurants.
sources.shortName: complete guide to your getaway

places.name: Bd de la Croisette

reviews.text: Among the movie stars! Beautiful boulevard where you can find nice restaurants,fancy boutiques and hotels.The beach is amazing.
Very nice street with shops and restaurants üòÉ

One of the most beautiful cities in Europe that I have visited. It really exudes unusual beauty and romance. The buildings are beautiful and I really like that kind of architecture. Along the coast of Cannes, there are beaches along almost the entire length. They are very clean and it is a real pleasure to swim. Lots of restaurants for every taste and pocket. And of course La Croisette! Beautiful!
I will be happy to visit Cannes again!

places.generalDescription: L'Affable is a stylish restaurant located in the heart of Cannes, offering classic French dishes with modern twists that incorporate Asian influences. The establishment has garnered praise for its Mediterranean cuisine served with friendly panache. Nestled on rue Lafontaine, it is known for its charm and warmth, providing great value for money.

sources.snippet: Explore the food magic of Cannes at L'Affable with chef Jean-Paul Battaglia. This restaurant on Rue la Fontaine mixes over 30 years of love into amazing meals that feel both cozy and new. Why we love it: L'Affable is special because it glows with warmth and plays soft music.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Restaurants In Cannes

places.name: L'Affable

reviews.text:
This is the best meal I had in Cannes.The service was excellent, the food  was out of this world. My rack of lamb smells so great, I want to lick to plate.
The fish was wonderful as well, that's very strange way make ordinary dishes to excellent

Of course let's not forget the most important thing the SOUFFLE.  Even you only order a one dishes you must order Souffie for dessert just to experiences.
Highly recommended

Loved the dining experience. Walked in at 7:15pm as I couldn't reserve for 1 online. Staff are kind, so attentive and with great humour! Food was absolutely superb especially the duck breast. I smiled through the whole time coz everything was so delicious. The atmosphere is also really lovely.

Wow! This restaurant was so good. Just be prepared to make a reservation in advance. I didn't make a reservation yet the chef still let me in (even though I had a time limit of about an hour). The menu is reasonably priced. I ordered a three course dinner. Truly the best restaurant I have been to in Cannes. So so good!!!

places.generalDescription: Palm Beach Cannes is a renowned peninsula known for its stunning beaches and luxurious properties. The western side features Boulevard de la Croisette and Bijou Plage, while the family-friendly Boulevard Gazagnaire runs along the eastern side facing Iles de Lerins. At the heart of the peninsula lies Place de l'Etang, home to the famous 1930s Palm Beach Casino and Port Canto yacht basin.

sources.snippet: In Palm Beach, all the way left from the centre (when facing the sea). Lots of pluche and gold, a restaurant, a nightclub, and a beach. Count your money and your blessings.
sources.shortName: What to see and what to buy in Cannes

places.name: Palm Beach Cannes

reviews.text: a magical complex filled with 6 restaurants a nightclub, ocean access and more. valet, a gym, and fun spots to go for a jog. love this location as it is centrally located as well.

If I could give 0 stars I would. This place is ridiculous and turned us away, little did they know we are high spenders and they lost out on so much!!! The rude security denied us entry due to me wearing shorts, mind you I was in nice linen dress shorts, then while waiting for our driver to come back and get us I watched them let in 5 other men in shorts, 3 of which were in jean shorts worn at essentially their ankles it was so ghetto. Do not recommend and will not be supporting this establishment

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. They denied me entry because I was in a wheelchair and explicitly said ‚Äúdisabled people are a problem for us‚Äù and to ‚Äúcome back when you can walk again‚Äù, ‚Äúwe don't allow disabled people to enter‚Äù and that I was ‚Äúinconvenient‚Äù for them. This is against French law and is discriminating behavior from their workers. Regardless of the wheelchair, my friends and I were dressed in very formal attire to adhere to their dress code. Find somewhere better to spend your money than this judgmental overpriced place

places.generalDescription: Waikiki - Restaurant Plage is a sleek venue located on a private beach, offering a delightful dining experience with seafood, steaks, and grilled fish paired with Proven√ßal wines. Guests can indulge in the quality of seafood while enjoying the romantic setting and great service. The mussels and fries are particularly recommended, accompanied by flavorful white wine sauce.

sources.snippet: Waikiki Plage transports you to an exotic paradise of yucca and bamboo. Let yourself be seduced by its lounge atmosphere and breathtaking view of the Mediterranean Sea. With comfortable deckchairs and beds, a Mediterranean-style restaurant, a friendly bar, disabled access and nearby parking, Waikiki Plage has everything to charm you.
sources.shortName: Affordable private beaches around Cannes

places.name: Waikiki - Restaurant Plage

reviews.text:
What a marvellous experience we had at Waikiki Plage.

Although the weather was not the greatest, we had such a great time here. My wife, Corina, our lovely puppy, Molly üê∂ and I, were welcomed by Marie-Jeanne and she served us with such kindness, she took care of Molly, as she was soaking wet, she brought us a towel and she looked after us the whole time.

We felt so welcomed and we enjoyed our afternoon here, serving some delicious Oysters and a bottle of Prosecco.

The deserts were absolutely app√©tissant. Merci Chef üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

Thank you so much Marie-Jeanne four everything, we will definitely come back here on our next trip from London ‚ù§Ô∏è

Incredible spot. ‚Ç¨20/‚Ç¨25 to rent the lounger for the day on a magnificent beach. The food here is worth the hype too. The duck was so tasty. The beach server was very friendly and attentive. I'll be back for sure xw

If you're not going to the beach club, definitely stop here for a drink at night! They have several low beach chairs in front of the water and it is gorgeous. Just be aware that the ‚Äòlarge' beer is a liter!

places.generalDescription: L√©rins Islands, located in the bay of Cannes, are a picturesque escape just 15 minutes away from the old port. The islands offer a blend of nature, spirituality, heritage, and vineyards. Visitors can explore the remnants of a medieval castle that once served as a base for monks on one of the islands. The area also boasts prestigious collections at a museum situated on the heights of Le Suquet with stunning panoramic views.

sources.snippet: The Lerins Islands, named after the eponymous monks who took control of Cannes in the 4th century AD, are just a 15-minute boat ride from Cannes‚Äô center. Visitors can explore the monastery on Saint-Honorat Island, where monks still live (and produce a Chartreuse-like liqueur called Lerina), or hike around the forest of eucalyptus and Aleppo pine trees on neighboring Sainte-Marguerite Island. Several companies provide transportation to the islands and boats depart in both directions regularly.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Cannes, the Jewel of the French Riviera

sources.snippet: In the turquoise waters of the bay of Cannes, facing the Croisette point, the two L√©rins Islands cultivate an art of living where nature, spirituality, heritage and vineyards are combined. They offer an idyllic setting to recharge one‚Äôs batteries and be nourished by stories, real or imaginary. The L√©rins islands are a 100% natural interlude in Cannes, located only 15 minutes by boat from the old port.
sources.shortName: Visiting Cannes: the must-see places

sources.snippet: Brunches on a terrace overlooking the sea, stepping back in time as you stroll through the narrow streets of Le Suquet, taking a boat for a green getaway to the L√©rins Islands, sipping a cocktail in one of the Croisette‚Äôs emblematic hotels and ending the evening with a concert at the Palais des Festivals.
sources.shortName: Your stay in Cannes | C√¥te d‚ÄôAzur France

sources.snippet: L√©rins Islands are a group of four islands located off the coast of Cannes. They‚Äôre accessible by boat, and a trip to these islands is a perfect way to spend a romantic day. You can explore the islands‚Äô natural beauty, including the Abbey of L√©rins, which is a historic monastery with a beautiful garden.
sources.shortName: Cannes' Romantic Charm: The Top 8 Date Spots to Explore

sources.snippet: Sainte-Marguerite and Saint-Honorat are unmissable if you are staying near Cannes. These two islands offer fascinating historical lessons!. Located opposite the Est√©rel massif and the bay of Cannes, these two jewels are easily accessible throughout the week but only by boat!
sources.shortName: Romantic Places On The French Riviera

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs also worth taking a short ferry ride out to the L√©rins Islands off the main coast. This group is comprised of four islands. There‚Äôs √éle Sainte-Marguerite and √éle Saint-Honorat, as well as two smaller uninhabited islands, √élot Saint-Ferr√©ol and √élot de la Tradeli√®re.
sources.shortName: Exclusive Things to do in Cannes

sources.snippet: The village was used as a guarding port to the Lerins Islands. In the 10th century, the city became known as Cannua, named after the reeds in the swamp (Canne). These small Ligurian ports had a tower that overlooked the swamp where the city of Cannes would later rise.
sources.shortName: What to see and what to buy in Cannes

sources.snippet: Embark on a seafaring adventure to the enchanting L√©rins Islands, where sparkling blue waters, vast landscapes, and historical treasures await exploration, providing a perfect backdrop for a family day out.
sources.shortName: Best things to do in Cannes, France this summer ‚Ä¢ SILC Academy

sources.snippet: Spend the day at the private beach CBeach on the Croisette, go shopping on Rue d‚ÄôAntibes, have a drink at Le Suquet, or take a boat trip to the L√©rins Islands. It all depends on your preferences!
sources.shortName: Looking for romantic things to do in Cannes in 2025?

places.name: L√©rins Islands

reviews.text: Two Islands out of time, so close to Cannes but so far away at the same time. Winter seems to never exist in Saint Margaret and her little sister, Saint Honorat. Modern statues have been immersed between the two Islands making their discovery full of mystery...and fun.
Every time I go to south of France üá´üá∑ I have to visit this beautiful place
Great place to bring family and friends

places.generalDescription: √éle Saint-Honorat is a picturesque island in the L√©rins group, known for its 15th-century fortified Cistercian monastery. The island is covered with vineyards and is home to some of France's last winemaking monks. Visitors can taste and purchase award-winning wines at a special degustation room and enjoy a meal at a high-quality restaurant.

sources.snippet: If you are looking for peace and quiet, you have come to the right island!. The peaceful and tranquil atmosphere of Saint-Honorat is not due to chance as it has been home to the Cistercian monks of the Abbey of L√©rins for several centuries. They produce quality wines on the 8 hectares of vineyards on the island.
sources.shortName: Visit Cannes in 3 hours

sources.snippet: Between Sainte-Marguerite Island and Saint-Honorat Island, you‚Äôll find something to delight you, whether it‚Äôs a historical stroll or a wine tasting from the monks‚Äô vineyards.
sources.shortName: Looking for romantic things to do in Cannes in 2025?

places.name: √éle Saint-Honorat

reviews.text: This place is a short cruise trip from Cannes. Boats start leaving from 10 am in morning and last from the island is around 430 pm, never miss it. You can spend a whole day exploring this small but beautiful island. There are multiple small beaches to swim and sun bathe. One of the destination of French Riviera.

Such a beautiful island! I definitely prefer this island to the bigger one. There are a lot less people and have quite a few cute quiet beaches. It takes a couple of hours to walk around the whole island but I definitely think you can make a whole day of it if you relax by the beach and then go sightseeing.

Beautiful, quiet, secluded island with a monastery and vineyards. Like l'√Æle Sainte-Marguerite, it is only accessible by ferry. There is a lovely, short walk around the island, and a nice restaurant overlooking the water.

places.generalDescription: Villa Domergue, a stunning manor house located in the hills above Cannes, was built in 1934 by the renowned French painter Jean-Gabriel Domergue. The villa showcases his artwork and that of his wife, Odette Maudrange-Domergue. Inspired by Venetian palaces, the property combines modern and old-world charm. The terraced gardens designed by Odette offer breathtaking views of the bay below.

sources.snippet: Villa Domergue is a stunning villa with beautiful gardens and a breathtaking view of Cannes. The villa hosts various art exhibitions and concerts throughout the year, making it a perfect spot for a cultural date. You can stroll through the gardens, take in the artwork, and enjoy the stunning views of the city and the sea.
sources.shortName: Cannes' Romantic Charm: The Top 8 Date Spots to Explore

places.name: Villa Domergue

reviews.text: Lovely and very romantic place! Highly recommended üíõüíõüíõ Nice to see beautiful villa and amazing garden. The view over Cannes is just super. Great sightseeing spot without a lot of tourists for romantic atmosphere.
Small garden but peaceful and there is a nice view. For the art lovers there is a small exhibition (Man Ray last time I went)
Beautiful view and scenery. . . Quite peaceful and not too far from the place we stayed

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Cannes, Palais St√©phanie Beach is a luxurious beach club and restaurant that offers a perfect combination of lively ambiance and stunning vistas of the Mediterranean Sea. With its plush lounge chairs, stylish umbrellas, and elegantly adorned cabanas, this beach destination sets the stage for a day filled with relaxation and enjoyment.

sources.snippet: Palais St√©phanie Beach in Cannes is a luxury beach club and restaurant. It sits by the sea, offering beautiful views and a cool, elegant vibe. Why we love it: This place is amazing because it's both comfortable and fancy.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Restaurants In Cannes

places.name: Palais St√©phanie Beach

reviews.text:
Cassandra was the best waitress ever!

The salmon poke was delicious and incredibly fresh. The caviar risotto was cooked perfectly and the beef tacos üåÆ juicy and savory.

Highly recommend everyone visit!

Elise and William were absolutely amazing, the most attentive service I've had in all of France. 10/10 on the food as well, we will be back because of the two of them.

For anyone looking for the best sushi and service, definitely consider Palais Stephanie.

The beach at Palais Stephanie is the ONLY place to be in Cannes in the summer. Friendly, clean and exceptional service. There is always a super warm welcome by everyone but especially Clemence and Thibault who work on the jetty. They are warm, welcoming and always attentive and helpful.   Nothing is too much trouble. Great guys.

places.address: 50 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France
